Reviews.Title: Not the worst, but not my favorite.
Reviews.Author: Cow Belle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone back in 2009 so I have been using it a little over two years. It was my first experience with a touch screen phone...it was frustrating. I would advise anyone purchasing this phone to get a clear screen protector as i managed to scratch mine the first day.Texting on this phone took a while to get used to. You can very easily hit the wrong button and can pretty much count on doing this in every text (even for the seasoned touch screen user). The nice thing is that you can change the font size of your text by pressing the volume button up or down when you are in the text--I partially wish that I could use the volume button to scroll down like it allows me to do when accessing lists in tools or my stuff, but it doesn't. So if you have a URL in your text it is a bit tricky to get past it without actually selecting it, but the phone is kind enough to ask you if your REALLY want to do that...it knows therefore it asks. You cannot store many texts in the phone. I have heard the figure of 200 tops and I believe it. Apparently texts are heavy and the phone does not want to carry them. It does automatically break up sent and received texts into multiple texts for you instead of giving you an error message. I like that. The video feature has an option where you can select lower quality to send a decently long video to someone via text even though it will be poorer quality--I appreciate that--the longer video, not the poorer quality. Sometimes when texting, the screen will sort of freeze for about 10 seconds and then all of the sudden add any and all letters you hit during its "power nap" to your text...most of the time. I reached the point where I would just continue to type and then the phone decided I was trying to outsmart it or overwork it so it wouldn't put those letters in my text...it is sad being outsmarted by a phone. Robots will take over someday, I just know it.Browsing on the web is ok. Some of the pages are slow loading and some just decide it isn't worth the effort. It does give you a little better view then some of the regular messaging phones and the touch screen can make the navigation a little easier in some ways, so that is a plus. The phone does have a very sensitive touch screen however, so in scrolling down a page, be prepared to accidentally click on a URL or two...or three...or ten.Battery Life is great. I can go about four or five days without charging it. I have to charge it every other day if I am using the phone heavily. I still have the original battery even two years later. That is nice.The alarm feature should probably be referred to as not an alarm...well, no, it does cause alarm when you wake up and realize that it slept in--heart palpitations galore (aka. ALARM). You see, the phone knew that you really wanted to sleep in, so it just didn't go off. Seriously though, the alarm worked about a dozen times and after that it just sort of stopped, every once in a while it will work, but not in any sort of reliable way. The phone allows you to set several alarms...so you can have all kinds of ALARM--not in the being notified when you should way though).Call quality was average. I say "was" because I can still hear people who talk to me, but the internal mic in my phone makes my voice sound very quiet to them, to the point where they basically can't hear me. Now my speaker phone still works. Apparently, it is a built in accountability system. Would I say some of the things I say if everyone could hear? I know the answer to that now, because I have to hold the phone in front of me and talk to it from a few inches away and have them on speaker phone. But, I will say, the speakerphone is fairly nice. You can hear them pretty well, although they have trouble hearing you if you have the phone more then two feet away from you.Finally, (though I can't imagine someone is actually still reading this epistle) I had "No Event" show up on my phone's homepage screen. I think this is a function of the calendar gone rogue. I clicked on it and it did not open. I tried to delete any events from the calendar to no avail. Either the phone is trying to rudely predict what my day will look like, me from the future is sending subliminal messages back to me present, or it is just a bug. I am going to go with the third one for piece of mind...that and I read other reviews of people who had this issue. To hide it (because it will never ever go fully away) you open the widget bar and shove it on there. You will then only see it as an exclamation point on the widget bar as if the phone is saying, "What gives!?"So there you have it. It is not the worst phone ever. It has some rosy and cheery points. This phone has brought me this far, which I appreciated, but it hasn't been my favorite phone. It did not make me feel warm and fuzzy towards Samsung in general, but in the event that machines/robots/computers take over the world I will not be surprised to see my phone was involved in the planning and executing of that master scheme.

Reviews.Title: Stay away!!!
Reviews.Author: tanyamarie
Reviews.Content: I liked this phone at first, for probably the first 2 or 3 months.  After that, I began having problems with it.  I started dropping MANY calls and then started making this high pitched buzzing noise when I was talking after the noise was over, it would drop my call or turn off.  I went to AT&T; and since the phone was still under warranty they shipped me a new one.  My husband has the same phone (but got his a little later and up to this point was not having issues either, so we figured it was just my phone).  Shortly after I received my new phone, my husband started having the same issues with his.  They sent him a new battery, but that did solve the problem.  My new phone worked fine, again for about 2-3 months.  Now it is doing the same thing.  AT&T; has horrible reception to begin with, but it is ever worse with this phone.  If I talk on it longer than 5 minutes it will probably drop my call or make the high pitched beeping noise (or both).  It is the WORST phone I have ever owned and would NEVER recommend it to anyone!!  DO NOT buy this phone!!!!

Reviews.Title: Works fine for me

Reviews.Content: This is my second Solstice. I wore the first one out after 4 years of hard use. I have a texting plan that gives me unlimited internet access and although I can't use APPS with it...no big deal  I don't need it for that. I use the phone to make phone calls. I can still go to mobile sites and read news, sports, weather, financials, find addresses and so on...It's a great texting phone for me.

Reviews.Title: Bad deal. Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I have used two Samsung phones before now and I was sold out on the fact that ALL their products are good. But I got a shocker of my life a few hours after this phone was delivered. The product which I bought for my daughter who lives outside the US was virtually dead on arrival - It took ages to get the battery charged and several hours to power the phone on. The worst experience I had was that each time I managed to power the phone on (and it takes a lot of pushing, pressing and fumbling with the power on key) the screen goes blank and black. I was so frustrated that I actually decided to return the product but after realizing that I might not get a replacement before my wife traveled out of the US, I decided to send the half-dead phone to my daughter with the hope that she could get some repair work done on it For now I have resolved that any product that goes by the name SAMSUNG should be avoided like a plague.

Reviews.Title: Not What I Thought
Reviews.Author: Tech Nutz "Ontario"
Reviews.Content: I was ready to move from my "prehistoric" flip phone in the direction of to-days smart phones.  All I really wanted was something with a touch screen that I could load some music onto, so I could leave my MP3 player at home when I travel.  The Solstice A887's listed features, along with the Samsung reputation for quality, appeared to indicate this device would allow me to take that first step towards the 21st century, (technologically speaking).  However, when I received the phone there seemed to be no easy way to download music.  A connection to my P.C. was not possible.  Unlike most phones or similar devices which connect using some form of USB connector, Samsung's connection is unique to that device.  The only way I could see to load music onto this phone was to purchase it using the installed AT&T; app.  Since I am not a AT&T; customer, that avenue appeared closed to me.  And quite frankly I don't want to purchase music when I have a huge amount of my favorites sitting on my P.C.The phone itself is quite nice looking with a reasonably responsive resistive touch screen.  And as soon as I installed the SIM card it very quickly connected to my Canadian cellular provider. However, the inability to load music was the deal breaker. The fact that it was loaded mostly with applications specifically for AT&T; was also a disappointment.  After I had taken a few minutes to assess this phone and it's features, I immediately re-packaged it for a return to Amazon and ordered another Samsung model from Amazon, which I hope will be more suitable to my needs.I do want to end on a positive note and express my admiration and thanks for Amazon's efficient and effective return policy.

Reviews.Title: Good phone but battery life is terrible
Reviews.Author: ML86
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a cheap replacement for my BlackBerry which I despised. I wasn't looking to spend alot of money as my contract with AT&T; expires in November and I just wanted a non-smart phone. This phone is easy to use, especially with being able to lock the phone on the top instead of having to type in an annoying security code and worrying about it butt dialing dialing 911 on you.The only complaint I have with this phone is that the battery life is deplorable, as in you had better plan on charging it TWICE A DAY, EVERY DAY. Even if you are not using it, the idle time will eat the battery up. I read other reviews that mentioned this same problem prior to when I purchased the phone, so I was not surprised.Additionally, the camera quality is not that great, but for the $65 I paid for the phone, I really can't complain. If you want a cheap replacement that is touch screen and easy to use, then this phone is for you. Oh, and plan on buying a special charger for it as it is not a standard USB port (one irritating part but chargers are relatively cheap and easy to find). Other than that, it works great and if it dies in a month, I've gotten my money's worth by not having to buy some $300 IPhone that will be outdated in 6 mos or less.
